remarks: The set of differentiable points is a subset of the interior of the domain of the function.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Aug-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 9-Feb-2015.)
statement:
dvcl.s $e |- ( ph -> S C_ CC ) $.
dvcl.f $e |- ( ph -> F : A --> CC ) $.
dvcl.a $e |- ( ph -> A C_ S ) $.
dvbssntr.j $e |- J = ( K |`t S ) $.
dvbssntr.k $e |- K = ( TopOpen ` CCfld ) $.
dvbssntr $p |- ( ph -> dom ( S _D F ) C_ ( ( int ` J ) ` A ) ) $.
